poem:
The World's Richest Bore  

At dawn's break, tweets cascade—  
islanders' calm fractured,  
not by sea's salt,  
but Musk's musings unleashed.  
In Madeira's embrace,  
a holiday ripples with his coin's tease—  
paper promises tossed  
like flotsam  
against Starmer's retreat.  
Beneath each digital wave,  
questions rise,  
wealth's shadow stretches.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trolling the UK: the issues enraging Elon Musk, world’s richest ‘pub bore’ While Keir Starmer was trying to enjoy a family holiday in Madeira over the new year, Elon Musk was trying to spoil it. The world’s richest man has been using X to lob insults and slurs in the direction of the prime minister, while teasing the prospect of donating tens of millions of dollars to the Reform UK party. This potentially gamechanging money". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

The world’s richest man has been using X to lob insults and slurs in the direction of the prime minister, while teasing the prospect of donating tens of millions of dollars to the Reform UK party. This potentially gamechanging money
